description: Learned borrowing from Medieval Latin aequiparātus, past participle of aequiparō (“put on a level with, compare”), from aequus (“equal”) +‎ parō (“place”).

verbs.description: equiparate (third-person singular simple present equiparates, present participle equiparating, simple past and past participle equiparated)

entries.meaning: (chiefly historical) To perform equiparation; to transfer attributes from one object or concept to another.
